member.name: T:Splat.MemoizingMRUCache`2
member.summary:
This data structure is a representation of a memoizing cache - i.e. a class that will evaluate a function, but keep a cache of recently evaluated parameters.
Since this is a memoizing cache, it is important that this function be a "pure" function in the mathematical sense - that a key *always* maps to a corresponding return value.
member.typeparam: The type of the parameter to the calculation function.
The type of the value returned by the calculation function.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The function whose results you want to cache, which is provided the key value, and an Tag object that is user-defined.
The size of the cache to maintain, after which old items will start to be thrown out.
A function to call when a result gets evicted from the cache (i.e. because Invalidate was called or the cache is full).

member.returns: The value that we have got.

An additional optional user-specific parameter.
member.returns: The value that we have got.

The result if available, otherwise it will be the default value.
member.returns: If we were able to retrieve the value or not.

member.summary: Gets or sets the dependency resolver. This class is used throughout libraries for many internal operations as well as for general use by applications. If this isn't assigned on startup, a default, highly capable implementation will be used, and it is advised for most people to simply use the default implementation.

member.name: P:Splat.Locator.CurrentMutable
member.summary: Gets or sets the mutable dependency resolver. The default resolver is also a mutable resolver, so this will be non-null. Use this to register new types on startup if you are using the default resolver.

member.name: M:Splat.Locator.RegisterResolverCallbackChanged(System.Action)
member.summary: This method allows libraries to register themselves to be set up whenever the dependency resolver changes. Applications should avoid this method, it is usually used for libraries that depend on service location.
member.param: A callback that is invoked when the resolver is changed. This callback is also invoked immediately, to configure the current resolver.
member.returns: When disposed, removes the callback. You probably can ignore this.

member.name: M:Splat.Locator.SuppressResolverCallbackChangedNotifications
member.summary: This method will prevent resolver changed notifications from happening until the returned is disposed.
member.returns: A disposable which when disposed will indicate the change notification is no longer needed.

member.name: M:Splat.Locator.AreResolverCallbackChangedNotificationsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates if the we are notifying external classes of updates to the resolver being changed.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the notifications are happening.

member.name: T:Splat.ModernDependencyResolver
member.summary:
This class is a dependency resolver written for modern C# 5.0 times. It implements all registrations via a Factory method. With the power of Closures, you can actually implement most lifetime styles (i.e. construct per call, lazy construct, singleton) using this.
Unless you have a very compelling reason not to, this is the only class you need in order to do dependency resolution, don't bother with using a full IoC container.
This container is not thread safe.
